guide.introduction: Write an Android app to control an LED light shirt. The app communicates to an ATmega128 via a BlueSMiRF Bluetooth transceiver. The microcontroller outputs data on the SPI to daisy-chained shift-register-controlled constant-current regulators driving RGB LEDs.
guide.introduction_rendered:
Write an Android app to control an LED light shirt. The app communicates to an ATmega128 via a BlueSMiRF Bluetooth transceiver. The microcontroller outputs data on the SPI to daisy-chained shift-register-controlled constant-current regulators driving RGB LEDs.

Relevant parts
  • Arduino or similar 8-bit microcontroller
  • Bliptronics LED pixel
  • Bluetooth Modem - BlueSMiRF Silver
  • Android phone
  • LM1084IT 5Amp 5V LDO Linear Regulator

lines.text: Solder LED Pixels in a daisy-chain, making sure wires are correctly ordered.
lines.text_raw: Solder LED Pixels in a daisy-chain, making sure wires are correctly ordered.

lines.text: Create micro-controller interface board and write embedded frame buffer code similar to code supplied by Bliptronics here:http://bliptronics.com/projects/LEDArdui...
lines.text_raw: Create micro-controller interface board and write embedded frame buffer code similar to code supplied by Bliptronics here:http://bliptronics.com/projects/LEDArduino1.aspx

lines.text: Multiple battery inputs (top right connectors) to extend battery life
lines.text_raw: Multiple battery inputs (top right connectors) to extend battery life

lines.text: Multiple power outputs (top left connectors) to reduce line losses along LED daisy-chain
lines.text_raw: Multiple power outputs (top left connectors) to reduce line losses along LED daisy-chain

lines.text: High current rated LDO Linear Regulator (and heat sink)
lines.text_raw: High current rated LDO Linear Regulator (and heat sink)

lines.text: Data lines to micro-controller board (i.e. Arduino) [Blue wires] for SPI and UART lines
lines.text_raw: Data lines to micro-controller board (i.e. Arduino) [Blue wires] for SPI and UART lines

lines.text: Create tabbed layout with activities to set parameters for different patterns. The 'set' button the sends command over bluetooth
lines.text_raw: Create tabbed layout with activities to set parameters for different patterns. The 'set' button the sends command over bluetooth

lines.text: Bluetooth from Android Bluetooth Chat example: http://developer.android.com/resources/s...
lines.text_raw: Bluetooth from Android Bluetooth Chat example: http://developer.android.com/resources/samples/BluetoothChat/src/com/example/android/BluetoothChat/index.html

lines.text: Vertical Seekbar by Neil D here:http://stackoverflow.com/questions/63123...

Just a word of caution that I was never able to get the BlueSmirf to consistently send data to the Android, only from the Android to the BlueSmirf. I forget, but you may also need to change the BUAD rate of the BlueSmirf which you can read how to due in the RN-42 AT Command Set.

guide.summary: This LED Light Shirt was designed by Michael Kane (me), and is controlled by an Android App also written by me. Worn to an 2011 Ann Arbor Halloween party, and if you're lucky you might see me biking around town wearing it!
